data.title: Netflix Awards Catalog: Complete List of Academy Award®, Emmy®, Golden Globe® and BAFTA Wins and Nominations
data.description: We’re incredibly proud of the Netflix films, series and specials that have received awards over the years. These are a testament to the immensely talented artists in front of and behind the camera who bring their very best work to Netflix, making us a global destination for exceptional storytelling. On January 23, Netflix received the following 18 Academy Awards® nominations across six films. Emilia Pérez received the highest number of nominations of any film this year and is the most nominated non-English language film ever with 13 nominations. The 2025 Academy Award winners will be announced at the awards ceremony on Sunday, March 2 in Los Angeles.
data.author: Netflix

data.title: 'BERLIN' Season 2 Starts Filming →
data.description: Netflix has announced the start of production for the second season of BERLÍN, the spinoff of La Casa de Papel, which continues to be in the Top 10 most-watched non-English language series in Netflix’s history. Pedro Alonso once again takes on the role of the iconic Berlin, and along with him, his entire gang returns: Michelle Jenner (Isabel) plays Keila, an eminence in electronic engineering; Tristán Ulloa (The Asunta Case) is Damian, a philanthropic professor and Berlin's confidant; Begoña Vargas (Welcome to Eden) is Cameron, a kamikaze who always lives on the edge; Julio Peña Fernández (Through my Window) Berlin's faithful squire; and Joel Sánchez plays Bruce, the relentless man of action in the gang.
data.author: Javi Roiz

data.title: Lunar New Year Must-Watch: Period Rom-Com Drama Series ‘Perfect Match’ Premieres January 25
data.description: Discover the hidden worlds of Star Wars and the mysteries that lie beneath the surface.
data.author: Vivien Tan

data.title: Moana 2 Surpasses Dune: Part Two
data.description: With a worldwide total over $717 million, the Disney animated sequel has become the fourth-highest grossing film of the year, behind Deadpool & Wolverine and Inside Out 2.
data.author: David Rayes

data.title: Born Again: Premiere Date, Trailer, Cast & More
data.description: The upcoming Disney+ series Daredevil: Born Again draws inspiration from the iconic comic story by Frank Miller and David Mazzucchelli, but it will diverge in significant ways. Featuring the return of Charlie Cox as Matt Murdoch and Vincent D'Onofrio as Wilson Fisk, the series explores Fisk's bid for mayor and Murdoch's struggle to rebuild his life. While initially planned to be episodic, production changes shifted the series back to a serialized format, reminiscent of the Netflix Daredevil series. Key returning characters include Karen Page (Deborah Ann Woll), Foggy Nelson (Elden Henson), and the Punisher (Jon Bernthal). The show will integrate broader MCU elements, addressing events like 'the Blip,' and is set in a changing New York City. Behind the scenes, creative shake-ups during the 2023 industry strikes led Marvel to reimagine the series to better align with fan expectations. Ultimately, Born Again promises a darker tone and a fresh start for the character while maintaining ties to the original Netflix series.
data.author: Michaela Zee

data.title: Oscars Will Move Away From Original Song Performances and Honor L.A. in Wake of Fires
data.description: The Oscars have shared details about how they will honor the city of Los Angeles amid the devastation caused by wildfires, along with other updates to this year’s ceremony.In a letter sent to Academy members, CEO Bill Kramer and President Janet Yang outlined plans for the 97th Oscars ceremony, set to take place on Sunday, March 2. The announcement comes on the heels of the devastating Los Angeles wildfires, with the Academy using the opportunity to highlight its commitment to the resilience of the film industry and its home city.
data.author: Clayton Davis

data.title: USC Scripter Awards Nominations: ‘The Wild Robot’ Surprises Alongside ‘Nickel Boys’ and ‘Sing Sing
data.description: The USC Libraries have unveiled the finalists for the 37th-annual Scripter Awards, spotlighting the writers behind 2024’s most celebrated film and television adaptations and the authors of the original works that inspired them. Among the film finalists, noteworthy Oscar hopefuls are among the nominees, each based on acclaimed literary works
data.author: Clayton Davis

data.title: Love Scout Dominates Most Buzzworthy Drama And Actor Rankings For 2nd Week In A Row
data.description: SBS’s “Love Scout” continued its reign over this week’s rankings of the most buzzworthy dramas and actors! For the second week in a row, “Love Scout” took No. 1 on Good Data Corporation’s weekly list of the TV dramas that generated the most buzz. The company determines each week’s rankings by collecting data from news articles, blog posts, online communities, videos, and social media about dramas that are either currently airing or set to air soon.
data.author: E Cha

data.title: Watch: GOT7's Jinyoung And Roh Jeong Eui Are Reunited By Fate In New Teaser For Romance Drama 'The Witch'
data.description: Channel A’s upcoming drama “The Witch” has unveiled a new teaser! Based on “Moving” author Kang Full’s webtoon of the same name, “The Witch” is a mystery romance about a woman who distances herself from the world due to tragedy and a man who refuses to give up on her.
data.author: E Cha

data.title: Gerard Butler's New Action Movie Passes Major Domestic Box Office Milestone After Just Three Weeks In Theaters
data.description: Gerard Butler has enjoyed a strong career in Hollywood, and his most recent release has only made him more prominent. The actor first rose to prominence with the role of Count Dracula in the vampire film Dracula 2000. Later, leading roles in the movies The Phantom of the Opera (2004) and P.S. I Love You (2007) helped establish him as a romantic lead. Yet, he truly earned global recognition by playing King Leonidas in Zack Snyder's historical action epic 300. This kick-started Butler's status as an action star and a nearly two-decade career as an icon of the genre.
data.author: Hannah Gearan

data.title: Mel Gibson’s ‘Flight Risk’ Leads Quiet Weekend With Decent $12M Opening
data.description: Mark Wahlberg stars in the genre pic, which marks Gibson's first directorial effort in nearly a decade. Elsewhere, Steven Soderbergh's artsy haunted house thriller 'Presence' opened in 1,750 cinemas.
data.author: Pamela McClintock

data.title: ‘Together’ at Sundance: Alison Brie and Dave Franco Open Up About “Risky” New Horror Film and Their Late Friend and Collaborator Jeff Baena
data.description: Beloved Hollywood couple Alison Brie and Dave Franco have teamed up on the big screen a handful of times already but their new collaboration tests their coupledom in new and horrific ways. And they wouldn’t want it any other way.
data.author: Chris Garder

data.title: Brad Pitt Reunites With Fury Director David Ayer For New Action Movie
data.description: Brad Pitt is reuniting with Fury director David Ayer for a new action movie, with the first story details being revealed. The actor first collaborated with the filmmaker on Fury which, written and directed by Ayer, follows a five-man American tank crew fighting in Nazi Germany during the final days of the European theater of World War II. The film was released in 2014 and was a box office success, grossing over $211 million, with reviews praising Pitt's performance and Ayer's visceral battle scenes that depict the horrors of war.
data.author: Adam Bentz

data.title: Which Side Is Peter On Now? The Night Agent Season 3 Mission Explained
data.description: In its second season, Netflix's hit action thriller The Night Agent set up what Peter's (Gabriel Basso) new mission will be in the third season of the show, but it's still unclear whose side he will be on. Following the success of The Night Agent season 1, Netflix renewed the show for a second season which sees Peter delve into his role as an official night agent. Like the first outing, The Night Agent season 2 features incredible action and an even better mystery for Peter to solve.
data.author: Memory Ngulube

data.title: “Maybe That’s Not Good Acting”: Benedict Cumberbatch Reflects On His Performance In The 2014 Movie That Earned Him His First Best Actor Oscar Nomination
data.description: Benedict Cumberbatch is an acclaimed actor on both the small and the silver screen. He became globally known when he played the titular Sir Arthur Conan Doyle detective in the BBC series Sherlock, which began in 2010. It was this show that earned the actor his first Emmy nomination for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Miniseries or Movie. He would go on to be nominated for Emmys for every single season of the series as well as its supplemental episode, 'The Abominable Bride.' Cumberbatch was later nominated for his work as the leading man in Patrick Melrose.
data.author: Lukas Shayo
